quest.name: A Sister's Ambition
journal: J'nairoh is concerned about her sister.
objectives: Search for the J tribe youngling.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Hey, you're one of those adventurers everyone's been talking about, right? I have a small favor to ask, if you'd be so kind.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Ever since the Resistance showed up, my sister's been running off to go train with spears, talking about becoming a lancer. I'd hoped it was just a phase, but she's been returning home later and later.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, it's almost time for us to get to working at the tavern and she's not back yet. She's never been late before, and I'm starting to worry. Do you think you could find her, and make sure she's okay?

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: She always practices close to home, so I doubt she could've gone far. Please find her for me.

dialogue.name: JASISTER02833
dialogue.text: My sister!? Oh no, have I been gone that long? I know she worries, but if I'm to improve with a lance I need to practice.

dialogue.name: JASISTER02833
dialogue.text: I've actually been at this longer than she thinks. We obviously couldn't handle weapons when the Garleans were still about, but I was quite fierce with a broomstick. I worked at it every day.

dialogue.name: JASISTER02833
dialogue.text: My mother would always boast about my aunt being the greatest lancer in all the realm. If I were that strong, then maybe...maybe I could have saved her.

dialogue.name: JASISTER02833
dialogue.text: I still have much training to do, but I swear on my spear no one will ever harm the people of Ala Ghiri ever again.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: My sister's returned home! Thank you so much for finding her.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: She told me about her plans, wanting to follow in the footsteps of our aunt. The Hellfire Phoenix, they called her.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Before I was born, she led others away from Gyr Abania to escape subjugation by the Garleans. From what I've heard she was incredibly brave, with a strong sense of justice.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: If my mother hadn't been pregnant with me, she likely would have left with her. <sigh> I sometimes wonder if she regretted not going.

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Now it seems my sister may someday leave as well. And someday I'll have tales to tell my children of their aunt's adventures in a distant land. Just like my mother...

dialogue.name: JNAIROH
dialogue.text: Goodness, listen to me and my crazed ramblings. You pay no attention to me. We'll be just fine.
